chargeHist.descr: Sexual Assault of a Child Under 16 Years of Age
Causing Child > 13 to View/Listen to Sexual Activity

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Sexual Assault of a Child Under 16 Years of Age
Causing Child >13 to View/Listen to Sexual Activity

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Luke A Schlussler

records.addlTxt:
10:30 am case called. Defendant Luke A Schlussler in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt appeared by video for Luke A Schlussler.  Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements. Defendant waives reading of Information and enters Not Guilty pleas- Received by the Court. 
Defense is to contact the Branch 1 judicial assistant to schedule.

9:31 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Luke A Schlussler in court, in custody with Attorney Karl A Schmidt.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 

Branch 1 for scheduling Arraignment.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
(11:34 AM case called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Luke A Schlussler appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Sonia L Anderson appeared by video for Luke A Schlussler.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
State requests $10,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Attorney Anderson requests signature bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $2,000.00 cash bond with conditions.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on August 22, 2022 at 3 pm.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with D.F. or D.F.'s residence or school. 
No contact with A.F. or A.F.'s residence or school. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level. 
No unsupervised contact with any minors.
